sentences.en: Alan was irritable, and very evidently in a nervy state.
sentences.cn: 艾伦很急躁，很明显他处于紧张不安的状态。

sentences.en: Evidently they had already heard about the fight with the dog - faces .
sentences.cn: 张惠如 知道一定是消息比他先到了.

sentences.en: Evidently you are in the wrong.
Evidently, he has fallen in love with Miss Green.
sentences.cn: 显然, 他爱上了格林小姐.

sentences.en: Evidently, the builders had finished and gone home early.
sentences.cn: 很明显，建筑工人干完活后早早回家了。

sentences.en: From childhood, he was evidently at once rebellious and precocious.
sentences.cn: 从儿时起，他就明显地既叛逆又早熟。

sentences.en: He began walking jerkily up and down, evidently unable to keep still.
sentences.cn: 他开始来回走动, 不能安静下来.

sentences.en: He was born evidently in London.
He was evidently too tired to go any further.
sentences.cn: 他显然太疲劳,一步也走不动了.

sentences.en: My presence in his sanctum was evidently esteemed a piece of impudence too shameful for remark.
sentences.cn: 我在他的圣地出现,显然被他看作是羞于提及的莽撞事情.

sentences.en: Self-evidently a handful of companies will benefit.
sentences.cn: 不言而喻的是少数几个公司会受益。

sentences.en: She walked slowly down the road, evidently in pain.
sentences.cn: 她沿路慢慢地走着，显然很痛苦。

sentences.en: She was evidently a heavy smoker.
She was evidently upset by what she saw.
sentences.cn: 她显然对所见到的事情感到不快。

sentences.en: There has evidently been a mistake somewhere, but surely that is all.
sentences.cn: 这件事显然是哪里出了一点儿岔子, 不过,可以肯定没什么大不了的.

sentences.en: They listened; evidently the distant shoutings were growing more distant!
sentences.cn: 他俩听着, 很显然本来就很遥远的喊叫声,现在听起来更远了.

sentences.en: They were evidently trying to frighten the public into obedience.
sentences.cn: 很明显,他们是要吓唬众人服从.

sentences.en: This man evidently did not know -- he had not read the papers.
sentences.cn: 这个人显然还不知道 -- 他没看到报纸.

trans.tran_cn: 明显地，显而易见，明显地，清楚地，错不了，毫无疑问
trans.tran_en: used to say that something is true because you can see that it is true
